intro: Scaphochlamys tahanensis, commonly known as the Tahanensis scaphochlamys, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, elongated floral structures known as scaphochlamys, which are specialized for pollination. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth surface and a slight pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
